launch.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to start something, usually something big or important
launch.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
The book launched his career as a novelist.
The press launched a vicious attack on the president.
launch.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make a new product, book etc available for sale for the first time
launch.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The company hopes to launch the new drug by next October.
launch.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to put a boat or ship into the water
launch.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space
launch.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
launch.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to make a computer program start
launch.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Double-click on an icon to launch an application.
launch.translation[1].definitions[0].def: when a new product, book etc is made available or made known
launch.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: the launch of a new women’s magazine
launch.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a large boat with a motor
launch.translation[1].definitions[2].def: when a weapon or spacecraft is sent into the sky or into space
launch.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to show or make a new product available for sale for the first time
launch.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The company is launching a new range of hair products.
The bank has launched a commercial insurance service for small businesses.
Our internet service will launch next year.
launch.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: Conran launched a business empire that was eventually to employ 83,000 people.
launch.translation[2].definitions[2].def: to start a new activity or profession, usually after planning it carefully
launch.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: The sports channel launched a major advertising campaign two months before the World Cup.
Luke took advantage of a Youth Training Scheme to launch a successful career.
launch.translation[2].definitions[3].def: if one company launches a bid for another, it makes an offer to buy it
launch.translation[2].definitions[3].exa: Several of its competitors may launch a bid for the company.
launch.translation[3].definitions[0].def: an occasion at which a new product is shown or made available for sale or use for the first time
launch.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Savings are needed to finance new product launches.
Since its launch two years ago, sales of the software have grown to only about 300,000 a year.
launch.translation[3].definitions[1].def: the start of a new activity or plan
launch.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: the launch on New Year’s day of a set of economic reforms
